document_title: Nephrotic syndrome: Causes, symptoms and treatment
subsection_name: hoi-chung-than-hu.json_11_How to care for patients with kidney failure?
subsection_content:
1. Living and resting regime
Patients should rest in bed and keep their heads elevated, especially during periods of severe edema and oliguria.; Keep the sick person warm, especially in winter; Limit movement and movement while swelling is still severe.
2. Take care of hygiene
Every day you need to clean your teeth, mouth and ears, nose and throat. Clean the skin by bathing or washing with warm water depending on the severity of the condition. When taking care of patients with nephrotic syndrome, it is important to note that fingernails and toenails need to be cut short and clean, avoiding scratches that cause scratches on the skin, especially when the patient is in damp places that can easily cause superinfection.; Make sure bed linen, clothing and other items are always clean.; Detect ulcers early to treat patients by washing with physiological saline and hydrogen peroxide. Other complications need to be carefully monitored to have a treatment plan for the patient.
3. Monitor patients with nephrotic syndrome
Vital signs such as pulse, breathing rate, temperature,  blood pressure.; Monitor urine quantity and color; Monitor your weight every day.; Monitor edema; Monitor abdominal pain; Monitor for complications and side effects from corticosteroid medications.
